meanings.definition: Located at or toward the stern of a vessel.
meanings.sent1: The sternforemost cabin on the ship offered a peaceful view of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The captain pointed to the sternforemost part of the boat, explaining its importance.
meanings.sent3: The sternforemost room was so tiny that only one person could fit inside at a time.
meanings.sent4: The sternforemost position on the ship was like being at the back of a long line.
meanings.sent5: The sternforemost location on the vessel was where the waves crashed against the hull.

meanings.definition: In a position with the stern leading or foremost.
meanings.sent1: The ship sailed sternforemost into the harbor, showcasing its impressive maneuverability.
meanings.sent2: The boat docked sternforemost, making it easier for the crew to unload the cargo.
meanings.sent3: The captain decided to park the boat sternforemost, causing a few raised eyebrows from onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The vessel moved sternforemost through the water, leaving a smooth wake behind.
meanings.sent5: The sailor expertly steered the ship sternforemost through the narrow channel.
